Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech, which is fundamental to a free society.
Misinformation and disinformation are subjective terms and should not be regulated by the government.
Experts are often wrong, and scientific progress relies on challenging existing paradigms.
The legislation infantilizes Australian citizens by assuming they cannot discern truth from falsehood.
Existing laws already cover incitement and harm, making additional legislation unnecessary.
The bill is perceived as leading to censorship and an Orwellian control over speech.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is absolutely required for freedom of thought, and without freedom of thought we cannot be free at all.
The remedy to controversial speech is NEVER censorship, it is always more speech.
No one, most particularly government bureaucrats, have a monopoly on the truth.
The reality of the implementation of this bill would be an Orwellian nightmare for the people of Australia, ruled over by our own Ministry of Truth.
